positioning_strategy_examples.description: Framework developers can choose from these positioning strategies based on their theoretical goals

strategy_1_vertical_clustering.use_case: Normative frameworks emphasizing moral hierarchy (e.g., Civic Virtue)

positioning_strategy.description: Wells clustered around vertical axis to emphasize moral hierarchy

strategy_1_vertical_clustering.example_result: Wells positioned at 60°-120° (positive) and 240°-300° (negative) for strong moral clustering

strategy_2_individual_angles.use_case: Frameworks with specific theoretical positioning requirements (e.g., custom research frameworks)

positioning_strategy.description: Framework developer specifies exact angle for each well based on theoretical model

strategy_2_individual_angles.example_result: Each well positioned exactly where framework developer specifies

strategy_3_even_distribution.use_case: Descriptive frameworks avoiding moral hierarchy implications (e.g., Moral Foundations Theory)

positioning_strategy.description: Wells distributed evenly around circle to avoid visual hierarchy
Wells clustered around horizontal axis for political left-right emphasis

strategy_4_horizontal_clustering.example_result: Wells positioned at 140°-220° (left) and 320°-40° (right) for political spectrum clustering

strategy_5_diagonal_clustering.use_case: Frameworks with diagonal opposition (e.g., authoritarian-libertarian vs left-right)

positioning_strategy.description: Wells clustered around diagonal axes for complex multi-dimensional frameworks

strategy_5_diagonal_clustering.example_result: Four-quadrant clustering for political compass style frameworks

for_framework_developers: Choose positioning strategy based on theoretical goals
Vertical clustering: Best for normative frameworks emphasizing moral hierarchy
Horizontal clustering: Best for political left-right frameworks
Diagonal clustering: Best for multi-dimensional frameworks (political compass style)
Individual angles: Best for precise theoretical positioning requirements
Even distribution: Best for descriptive frameworks avoiding implications
clustering_orientations: Custom angles: Any orientation based on theoretical needs
configuration_flexibility: Span parameter: Adjust tightness of clustering (30°-90° typical range)
Center angles: Position clusters anywhere on circle (0°-360°)
Multiple clusters: Support 2, 3, 4, or more clusters per framework
Well type mapping: Assign any well types to any clusters
Mixed approaches: Some wells clustered, others individual
Framework-agnostic: Engine supports any clustering terminology
backward_compatibility: Automatic conversion from old CV framework format
